body_html: How big are your local variables? There's some slowness in current version if they are too big -- #6116 . Work-around is to use the patch from that issue or shard them into 100MB chunks. Also, what does your session.run looks like? If you do something like sess.run(assign_op) then you are fetching result to Python which is slow for grpc sessions (#6256), the solution is to do sess.run(assign_op.op)
body_text: How big are your local variables? There's some slowness in current version if they are too big -- #6116 . Work-around is to use the patch from that issue or shard them into 100MB chunks. Also, what does your session.run looks like? If you do something like sess.run(assign_op) then you are fetching result to Python which is slow for grpc sessions (#6256), the solution is to do sess.run(assign_op.op)
body: How big are your local variables? There's some slowness in current version if they are too big -- https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/6116 . Work-around is to use the patch from that issue or shard them into 100MB chunks. Also, what does your `session.run` looks like? If you do something like `sess.run(assign_op)` then you are fetching result to Python which is slow for grpc sessions (https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/6256), the solution is to do `sess.run(assign_op.op)`
